title: Don’t Restore Your iPhone
text: The Microsoft authenticator app does not store the two factor codes through icloud back up by default. The only way it will use iCloud is to use a personal Microsoft account. I’m attempting to use this with my company’s exchange, which makes it kind of useless.

title: Terrible system
text: This app is the bane of my life. I got a new phone and now I can’t sign into anything. You have to use the Authenticator app TO SIGN INTO the Authenticator app!! How does that make any sense?? And there’s no support line so now I’m just completely locked out of my work email. I can’t believe nobody realized what a terrible system this is, and I can’t believe that I’m the only person this has happened to but there is zero help online. If your organization is making you use this, good luck.

title: Never have to remember passwords on all my devices
text: I use Authenticator with edge browser on all my devices (Mac and PC). I never have to remember a password or account name. All the login info syncs across devices and I can use iPhone autocomplete synced with Authenticator to avoid typing passwords too.

title: For coders
text:
Well, I tried giving up feedback, but that link is broken.

I like this app, but I have used it for several accounts, and two of those are for the same website, so for different accounts. This app shows the same name for both, and I have no way of putting a nickname on them to tell them apart.

Please add some sort of nickname feature, so I can distinguish several accounts.

title: Better than Google
text:
Love this app. I started using it on 5-3-18. World great and no issues. Backup in iCloud is perfect.

Feature request: would be even better to have TOUCH ID option to open the app for added security.

Issues: there would sometimes be no notifications or a delay, both in the app or when the phone is locked.

title: Dark mode needed and transfer is a bit buggy
text:
Good app, works as intended. However, dark mode is needed as I get blinded by it every time I have to open it late at night. It’s 2023. Please just do it.

Also, I use two phones. Transferring data from one phone to the other is not as seamless as I would like.

title: Why do I have to use this?
text:
Microsoft forcing us to use this app to log into our email has got to be the most stupid thing anyone has ever thought of. If people want to use an Authentication app, great! But why do I have to download a whole separate app and open my phone every time I want to log into my email if I don’t care?

I have nothing to protect; it’s complete overkill and makes logging into my own stuff incredibly inefficient and honestly just annoying. I literally hate this.

title: Doesn’t save your info if logged out.
text: I thought Microsoft would keep my authenticators saved if I lost my phone or got logged out. Turns out it doesn’t because I got a new phone then logged into Authenticator on it and bam all my Authenticator were gone. Google and Microsoft’s authenticators have both done me wrong in that regards. How hard is it to not keep your authentications saved/synced. Regardless with any Authenticator I guess don’t lose your phone or get logged out because you are screwed.

title: Great app, but.
text: I enjoy using the Microsoft Authenticator App, but; it’d be nice if they created a Mac App as well. I’m really trying to leave my phone in another room while I work but I need it to authenticate into different applications. I’m eyeing another authentication app that has a Mac, Watch, iPad and iPhone app… I just don’t feel like moving all of my accounts 😭

title: The most good Authenticator out there!!!
text: Sorry this is kinda short, but the reason why I give this 5 starts is that it always recovers my account. So if I ever upgrade or lose my phone, I can always recover it. On top of more features. More than 5 starts honestly.

title: No customer service
text: Everything is great until you change your number. I’ve been locked out of services I pay for (for 30 days) and my laptop all because I bought a new phone. You know who should be able to fix this? CUSTOMER SERVICE but unfortunately we live in a world where customer care is prohibited.

title: Dont update the app dumps all your accounts
text:
After updating all my accounts were dumped and it was like I had just downloaded app first time. Because I had just updated my ios, I was also locked out of my mail app and could not get access to email until I returned home to get backup notes for passwords. Total inconvenience and short sightedness from app developers.
Does anyone at microsoft try to fix this or has this app become the curse of bill gates?

title: Update after update and it still does not rotate
text: I keep updating and updating this app but I see no changes. There’s no new functionality and the one that I keep asking for is to be able to rotate the app when in landscape mode and it still does not do that. The phone is a 6 inch size my screen the Fontana is still like four points and 90% of the screen is wasted. Why not maximize it and utilize all of that extra space for a larger display of the number.

title: I couldn’t make a less user friendly app if I tried
text: I was forced to install this on my work devices. I’m all for extra security but this thing is just awful. It so I user friendly, I’d rather just post all my passwords online for everyone to use.  If you’re in IT and trying to decide if it’s a good solution, there are several more user friendly options beyond this one. The devs should be completely barred from ever making software again. It’s an absolute joke

title: Disappointed
text: With the new update if someone has had your account on their Authenticator app previously they can hack into your account and steal it!, it would be very good if they remove the ability to change info on the app!

title: Never had an issue
text: At this point I just assume anything created by Google is going to end up being cancelled, so why would I trust them to maintain access to all of my OTPs? Microsoft isn’t exciting, but they don’t seem to be going anywhere

title: Codes refreshes to quickly
text: I am a huge fan of xbox and gaming, but being told that i need to create a new password when I have my current password for what feels like forever. Also i turned two-step verification thinking that is a way around having to not create a new password for my account. No when I try to let my friend log on to my account so he can help with a game that I don’t have a whole lot of time to play as much as i would like

title: So far so good
text: I just installed the app and so far it seems to be working correctly. I’m going to give it 5 stars for now but after reading the reviews I’m not sure if it’s going to be a problem or not. I’m just going to have to wait and see. I would advise caution when installing the app.

title: It’s an endless loop
text: I am trying to set up my work email and admin settings.  I go to the app and it wanted me to download this.  I follow the steps and it says I need to use a web browser to complete and to click the link.   I click the link and it takes me to the same page saying I need to download the app.   The app is already downloaded.  I need this this for all of my work emails and settings but it will not allow log in and there is zero help from your “help”

title: Apple Watch support must stay
text: I am using this app for all my MFA needs and love it.  Approving on the watch is one of its best features!   Why would you kill it?!  Stop adding useless features like addresses and password manager and focus on the core reason for this app.

title: Apple Watch app needs updating
text: Enforcing the number matching method broke the Apple Watch app. You can see the notifications, but there really should be an interface on the watch itself to type in a number so you aren’t forced to just use phone app. Otherwise, the app is pretty great.

title: Disappointed Apple Watch Support was removed
text:
Since I keep my iPhone in my pocket while I work, I used the Apple Watch app to authenticate all day long. Well, Microsoft succeeded in making MFA even more annoying, again. 
How about we bring back the Apple Watch Authentication?  It worked great, and doesn’t require me to pull my phone out, which leads to distractions. Which drops productivity. 

#WishYouHadNotDoneThat
#WhyDidYoiMakeMyJobHarderAgain

title: Beats SMS!
text: Microsoft’s Authenticator just works! It’s a simple, easy to use app that provides you with the security you need to protect your accounts. In addition, it allows for the addition of new accounts easily. It’s a must have that can be used flexibly in many instances! A good, stable app; highly recommended !

title: No push notification anymore
text: After the last update I am no longer receiving a push notification anymore. I looked in settings and didn’t see anything. Is there somewhere to set it so I get the notification again?

title: Notification Sounds Not Working
text: Simple app but handles my company’s MFA requirement for e-mail well. The only complaint I have is recently, the notification sounds haven’t been working, even though they are turned on and all other apps make the sound.

title: Great App keeps my accounts secure.
text: I got an alert to authenticate a sign in to one of my accounts. I was not on that account so I quickly denied the authentication. I ran to my account and it luckily no one had hacked into my account and did not need to reset my password.

title: Awesome app. The most annoying bug
text: Please stop forcing me to sign in twice, once for verifying an app login and then a second time to get into the app to view codes. It makes no sense, I am using the same credentials.. If you’d just preserve my login token for just one more step! I’ll update my review when the app gets an update to resolve this annoying bug.

title: Very Confusing
text:
I was born in 1996 and I grew up on a computer. Literally rearranging my Windows desktop at age 3. 
Please, for new users you need to explain what the app does when you first sign into it, like instructions and an explanation of what the app does for your accounts with a diverse set of apps across the board.

title: App shuts down phone
text: Any time this app needs to be used, it glitches and doesn’t let me into my account. Then the rest of the phone glitches (keyboard doesn’t appear, browser pages don’t load, etc.)

title: Removed the Apple Watch Button
text: This app was fine, nothing to write home about but it does it job. However it was super easy and convenient to approve authentication on my Apple Watch via notification instead of having to pull my iPhone out of my pocket or go find wherever I left it. Not sure why they would remove such a simple and convenient feature other than it’s Microsoft not liking Apple and being petty. Please bring this back!

title: I don’t get it
text: When I try to put my blackboard account for my outlook, it tells me to use the Authenticator app(this app) but I can’t because I have to add my blackboard in here and it keeps telling me to use the Authenticator app to add it but I can’t!

title: Endless Feedback Loop
text: Normally apps like these aren’t much of an issue, but this is the hardest lock with no way to fix if it’s broken. I accidentally deleted this app and it was my only way into my work iPad. I can’t access my account now and no matter what my team and I did, there wasn’t much we could do. This is a huge problem and I’m not the only one to deal with it! At the very least, there needs to be a way to deal with it on all levels.

title: Complete Failure
text: My app has been working flawlessly until, seemingly, it tried to update itself through the night? All of a sudden today I am no longer able to receive validation codes and ended up locked out of all of my accounts. The restore from backup also failed and, as others have indicated, yes I have backups. This wasted so much of my and others’ time today trying to work around such a stupid problem.

title: App is terrible
text: Recently they provided an update for the Authenticator app and the app now is not good at all my account has gotten hacked and many of my other accs the app overall isn’t bad but it’s just the bug where u can update info it’s not good at all the need to go back to the old version and not this new version please Authenticator app leader or organization if your reading this please fix the app or do something because the app is getting people’s accs taking on a daily to day basis it’s not a good app as of right now

title: Doesn’t transfer to new iPhone!!
text: I have iCloud backup turned on for everything and am always careful about this, but Microsoft decided not to transfer my passwordless Microsoft account to my new phone, forcing me to go through the FULL account recovery procedure. If you’re going promote an app to be your sole sign in method, it needs to work 100% of the time, or customers will lose accounts. Microsoft hasn’t figured that out and apparently didn’t fully test this.

title: Useless
text: This authenticator is useless! I have been trying to change my password on my Xbox account because I can’t remember it and it won’t let me change it since I don’t have the authenticator app to verify it’s me. Then I get the authenticator app and it wants my password that I can’t remember so then authenticator app wants me to use the authenticator app to verify it’s me so that I can then change my password and to then use the authenticator app. Stupidest thing Microsoft has ever done

title: Search option too slow
text: As it stands now, the search button take 2 full seconds to display the keyboard to begin typing…either Enable the built in search behavior that iOS settings app has where you can pull down and the search comes up. Or have the search bar always visible

title: Nightmare!
text: Worst app I've ever used. I can't get emails, can't get into any of my accounts. I've tried many, many, many times to delete this app, but I'm unable to!  My husband, daughter and son-in-law, have all tried (all very technical) and can't delete it!!  I've tried to get in touch with Microsoft and, you can only chat online!  But, only thing is, they say someone will help you soon...but no one ever comes online to help me!!  And I've tried several times!

title: Solid. But slow. And please allow iOS12 to pass thru OTP
text:
Overall, it’s a quite decent product.  My company makes me use it in combination with office 365, otherwise I don’t think I’d voluntarily use it. 

However, I would be significantly happier with this product if it allowed iOS12 to pass through the OTP and automatically paste it into the app without me having to type it up. Most other apps can do that - surely it’s not that hard to implement. 

Thank you

title: Version history not helpful
text: The version history info doesn’t provide anything about the actual bug fixes. It would be nice to know if a problem we have experienced has been fixed

title: Obsolete and unintuitive
text: App is the same name as all other authenticator apps, which either shows hubris or stvpidity, then it doesn’t transfer your data into a new phone, making the whole idea of the 2 factor authentication pointless. On top of that, when recovering the account, it asks for you to authenticate it on the app you’re trying to recover. How obtuse is that? This is a great example of obsolete app development.

title: Infinitely dislike it
text:
It’s required for me to go to college. Two weeks feel like twelve hours 

It’s taken me to the app to put my email password and then asked me for the number it gives me and blocked the number with that same question making me guess from 01 to 99. 

It scans my face too soon and never gets it right so I had to disable that feature

I wish it had the option to auto authenticate for certain apps or websites. I don’t think college should have two brick walls in front of it. 

There’s at least the feeling of safety even though it seems that it’s extremely low risk for college.

title: Absolutely useless if you have to sign in a second time
text: This app is allowing me to sign in, as it should, but then, how stupid do you have to be to make me USE the Authenticator WHILE I’m trying to sign INTO the app. I can’t even get or see any codes because I’m not even logged into the app yet but nooooooooo you have to be logged in TO LOG INTO the app. Such a stupid flaw that really made me uninstall. Sure it works and it’s secure but holy **** did that design make me question if I needed the app.

title: No more Apple Watch
text: Boooo that was one of the most handy features. I feel like Microsoft overall is just giving up on things instead of fixing or improving things. It’s like a car company that keeps turning things off your expensive car because they just don’t want to spend the money anymore now that they already have you.

title: Removed Apple Watch support. Deletion time
text:
My work must have gotten to MS. Because now my watch can no longer approve that it me trying to access my work. I swear my work grooves on trying to make it so difficult to login.. 
I will delete this app and have it go back to calling me on my cell phone and hit “#” to access my work. Much faster and easier than open app, most times log into app, approve connection, wait, approved. 

Very disappointed Bill Gates…

title: Apple Watch Feature Removed
text:
Hi Developers,

I really enjoyed the feature of using Apple Watch to do 2-factor verifying and it was really convenient, thanks to your hard work. I don’t understand why you remove this feature in recent updates — I don’t see any security threat.

title: Unable to restore backup
text: “Something went wrong…” When trying to restore from backup. In the past 2 days, I’ve seen at least 30 posts and reviews about people having the same issue when attempting to restore their backup or even create a new backup. Microsoft support has been useless to say the least. They told me to post on the forums where a bunch of other people have already reported the problem.

title: Annoying Authenticator
text: The new Microsoft authentication is super annoying. Instead of just approving entry, I now have to type the number shown, but the number moves so fast and behind the entry screen so I have to tap hide to see the number. It then makes me wait 5 whole seconds before the number entry reappears. They should make the number slide on screen slower or shorten the hide feature to 1-2 seconds. Stop making stupid changes!

title: Application does not display accounts/aliases properly
text:
When one increases the text size on the iPhone, the earlier versions of the application displayed the alias and account names appeared properly. 

Now the accounts do not appear properly unless the font size is decreased - this of course leads those with visual difficulties are not able to use other applications properly because the fonts are too small to see the content. 

Please fix this by enabling larger fonts and expanding the window per record displayed. 

Thanks!

title: No way to easily find things
text: Some sources have a little icon by them, making them easy to spot in a large list. Unfortunately, this app doesn’t have many built-in company logos and it does not let you add any. There’s also no search function. So if you have a lot of accounts, you have to scroll through the list to manually find anything.
